roles.note: Usually the cause and the acclaimed party are merged, as in the first example. (from acclaim.01-v)

example.name: usually just transitive
example.text: On Oct. 3, following conversations with Secretary of State James Baker,[Soviet Foreign Minister Eduard Shevardnadze]-1 arrived in Managua [*-1} to acclaim ``Nicaragua's great peace efforts.''

example.name: oddly with cause
example.text: Mary acclaimed John for cleaning the garage.

example.name: passive
example.text: [The series]-1 was critically acclaimed *trace*-1 for its thoughtful and intense treatment of difficult issues.
example.arg: for its thoughtful and intense treatment of difficult issues

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: The manager's acclaim of John's report caused envy among his co-workers.
